poem:
### The Silent Struggle

In the cold light  
of modern dawn, men stand  
alone, shadows  
etched against society's  
walls. Words unsaid  
press against the chest;  
the burden of a mask  
worn too well. There's a feminine  
whisper now, tender  
and bold—it calls,  
reminds us: we're all fragile  
in the end, needing  
only a hand to reach.
